Annotation.String: This is the schema definition for the Drive resource. It represents the properties for physical disk drives for any system.
This resource shall be used to represent a disk drive or other physical storage medium for a Redfish implementation.
This action is used to securely erase the contents of the drive.
This defines the name of the custom action supported on this resource.
The state of the indicator LED, used to identify the drive.
This value of this property shall contain the indicator light state for the indicator light associated with this drive.
This is the model number for the drive.
The value of this property shall be the name by which the manufacturer generally refers to the drive.
The revision of this Drive
This property shall contain the revision as defined by the manufacturer for the associated drive.
The size in bytes of this Drive
This property shall contain the size in bytes of the associated drive.
Is this drive currently predicting a failure in the near future
This property shall contain failure information as defined by the manufacturer for the associated drive.
The protocol this drive is using to communicate to the storage controller
This property shall contain the protocol the associated drive is using to communicate to the storage controller for this system.
The type of media contained in this drive
This property shall contain the type of media contained in the associated drive.
This is the manufacturer of this drive.

The value of this property shall be the name of the organization responsible for producing the drive. This organization might be the entity from whom the drive is purchased, but this is not necessarily true.
This is the SKU for this drive.
The value of this property shall be the stock-keeping unit number for this drive.
The serial number for this drive.
The value of this property shall be a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the drive.
The part number for this drive.
The value of this property shall be a part number assigned by the organization that is responsible for producing or manufacturing the drive.
The user assigned asset tag for this drive.
The value of this property shall be an identifying string used to track the drive for inventory purposes.
The Durable names for the drive
This property shall contain a list of all known durable names for the associated drive.
The form factor of this drive
This property shall contain the form factor for the associated drive.
The type of hotspare this drive is currently serving as
This property shall contain the hotspare type for the associated drive.
The encryption abilities of this drive
This property shall contain the encryption ability for the associated drive.
The status of the encrytion of this drive
This property shall contain the encrytion status for the associated drive.
The rotation speed of this Drive in Revolutions per Minute (RPM)
This property shall contain rotation speed of the associated drive.
The size of the smallest addressible unit (Block) of this drive in bytes
This property shall contain size of the smallest addressible unit of the associated drive.
The speed which this drive can communicate to a storage controller in ideal conditions in Gigabits per second
This property shall contain fastest capable bus speed of the associated drive.
The speed which this drive is currently communicating to the storage controller in Gigabits per second
This property shall contain current bus speed of the associated drive.
The percentage of reads and writes that are predicted to still be available for the media
This property shall contain an indicator of the percentage of life remaining in the Drive's media.
The links object contains the links to other resources that are related to this resource.
The Actions object contains the available custom actions on this resource.
An array of references to the volumes contained in this drive. This will reference Volumes that are either wholly or only partly contained by this drive.
The value of this property shall be a reference to the resource that this drive is associated with and shall reference a resource of type Volume.
The drive media type is traditional magnetic platers
The drive media type is solid state or flash memory
The drive media type is shingled magnetic recording
The drive is 1.8 inches in width
The drive is 2.5 inches in width
The drive is 3.5 inches in width
The drive conforms to the m.2 standard
The drive is not currently a hotspare
The drive is currently serving as a hotspare for all other drives in the storage system
The drive is currently serving as a hotspare for all other drives in the chassis
The drive is currently serving as a hotspare for a user defined set of drives
The drive is not capable of self encryption
The drive is capable of self encryption per the Trusted Computing Group's Self Encrypting Drive Standard
The drive is capable of self encryption through some other means
The drive is not currently encrypted
The drive is currently encrypted but the data is accessible to the user unencrypted
The drive is currently encrypted and the data is not accessible to the user, however the system has the ability to unlock the drive automatically
The drive is currently encrypted, the data is not accessible to the user, and the system requires user intervention to expose the data
